CIP codes for physical sciences

Source: R/data.R
phys_sci.Rd

Classification of Instructional Programs (CIP) 6-digit codes for physical science programs, series 40.

phys_sci

Format

A character vector.

Source

CIP 2010, US National Center for Education Statistics, https://nces.ed.gov/ipeds/cipcode.

Examples

head(phys_sci, n = 10L)
#>  [1] "400101" "400201" "400202" "400203" "400299" "400401" "400402" "400403"
#>  [9] "400404" "400499"

print(cip_filter(phys_sci))
#> # A tibble: 42 x 6
#>    CIP2  CIP2name          CIP4  CIP4name           CIP6  CIP6name             
#>    <chr> <chr>             <chr> <chr>              <chr> <chr>                
#>  1 40    Physical Sciences 4001  Physical Sciences  4001~ Physical Sciences    
#>  2 40    Physical Sciences 4002  Astronomy and Ast~ 4002~ Astronomy            
#>  3 40    Physical Sciences 4002  Astronomy and Ast~ 4002~ Astrophysics         
#>  4 40    Physical Sciences 4002  Astronomy and Ast~ 4002~ Planetary Astronomy ~
#>  5 40    Physical Sciences 4002  Astronomy and Ast~ 4002~ Astronomy and Astrop~
#>  6 40    Physical Sciences 4004  Atmospheric Scien~ 4004~ Atmospheric Sciences~
#>  7 40    Physical Sciences 4004  Atmospheric Scien~ 4004~ Atmospheric Chemistr~
#>  8 40    Physical Sciences 4004  Atmospheric Scien~ 4004~ Atmospheric Physics ~
#>  9 40    Physical Sciences 4004  Atmospheric Scien~ 4004~ Meteorology          
#> 10 40    Physical Sciences 4004  Atmospheric Scien~ 4004~ Atmospheric Sciences~
#> # ... with 32 more rows
